A Complete Guide to Self Employed Visa Canada from India

You can immigrate to Canada as a self-employed person through a Self-Employed Visa Canada from India. Self-employed artists, athletes, and applicants under eligible occupations can apply for the Self-Employed Persons Program.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Overview” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]Indian nationals interested in permanent residence in Canada can apply through various immigration programs. IRCC introduced the Self Employed Visa Canada to enhance the social fabric of its communities by creating a unique program targeting people from athletics and cultural activities. The Self-Employed Persons Program (SEPP) is best suited for specific types of self-employed Indian nationals.

The Self-Employed Visa Canada from India is preferable for individuals who may not qualify under the Federal Skilled Worker Program. It offers a straightforward pathway for permanent residency.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”3/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”What is Self-Employed Visa Canada?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665078373137{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]The Self-Employed Visa Canada specifically targets applicants who may not fit into the regular Federal Skilled Worker program because of the type of occupation they represent. If you take an example of a cricketer, a dancer, or a movie director, they might be doing some great work in their field and still may not qualify as per the work experience requirements for a skilled worker.

Some Indian applicants may qualify for both the Federal Skilled Worker Program and the Self-Employed Person’s Program.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Eligibility Requirements: Canada Self Employed Visa from India” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1669558353795{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665076244305{margin-top: 20px !important;margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”]Indian applicants must meet several requirements to be eligible under the Self-Employed Persons Program. This includes requirements for:

  • Eligible Occupations under Self-Employed Visa Canada
  • Work Experience Requirements
  • Self-Employment Requirements
  • Security, Medical, and Other Criteria
[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Work Experience”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665076558407{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Indian self-employed applicants must possess the relevant experience to be eligible for this program. In this case, relevant experience refers to the experience acquired while working in athletics or cultural activities at a world-class level.

Individuals that have worked as self-employed professionals in athletics or cultural activities are also included in this definition.

Prospective Indian applicants must gain this relevant experience in the five years preceding their application. Applicants with experience in cultural activities must meet the following requirements:

  • Providing two examples of one-year periods in which the applicant was self-employed in cultural activities.
  • Providing two examples of one-year periods in which the applicant was participating in cultural activities at a world-class level.
  • A combination of the above two schemes, with one year of experience in each.

Applicants with experience in athletics must meet the following requirements:

  • Provide two examples of one-year periods in which the applicant was self-employed in athletics.
  • Provide two examples of one-year periods in which the applicant was participating in athletics at a world-class level.
  • A combination of the above two schemes, with one year of experience in each.
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Self-Employment Experience”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665076685800{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Applicants must possess relevant experience as self-employed individuals. Such applicants must also be willing and able to work as self-employed in athletics or art once they arrive in Canada.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Security, Medical, and Other Criteria”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665076747992{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Indian applicants are required to undergo medical exams and security checks to ensure they are admissible to Canada. These applicants must also demonstrate that they possess enough funds to sustain themselves and their families while living in Canada.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Self-Employed Visa Occupation List”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1669383204090{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]The list of occupations approved under the Self-Employed Visa Canada and the corresponding NOC code is shown below:

TEER CategoryNOC CodeOccupation   
550010Library, archive, museum and art gallery managers
550011Managers - publishing, motion pictures, broadcasting and performing arts
550012Recreation, sports and fitness program and service directors
551100Librarians
551101Conservators and curators
551102Archivists
551110Editors
551111Authors and writers (except technical)
551112Technical writers
551113Journalists
551114Translators, terminologists and interpreters
551120Producers, directors, choreographers and related occupations
551121Conductors, composers and arrangers
551122Musicians and singers
552100Library and public archive technicians
552110Film and video camera operators
552111Graphic arts technicians
552112Broadcast technicians
552113Audio and video recording technicians
552114Announcers and other broadcasters
552119Other technical and coordinating occupations in motion pictures, broadcasting and the performingarts
552120Graphic designers and illustrators
552121Interior designers and interior decorators
553100Registrars, restorers, interpreters and other occupations related to museum and art galleries
553110Photographers
553111Motion pictures, broadcasting, photography and performing arts assistants and operators
553120Dancers
553121Actors, comedians and circus performers
553122Painters, sculptors and other visual artists
553123Theatre, fashion, exhibit and other creative designers
553124Artisans and craftspersons
553125Patternmakers - textile, leather and fur products
553200Athletes
553201Coaches
553202Sports officials and referees
554100Program leaders and instructors in recreation, sport and fitness
555109Other performers
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Selection Criteria for Self-Employed Persons Program

[/nectar_highlighted_text][vc_column_text]Indian applicants will receive application points based on various selection criteria. They must achieve a minimum of 35 points to be eligible for the Self-Employed Persons Program. The selection criteria areas are discussed below:[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Education” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077103888{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665077179859{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Applicants can receive up to 25 points in the education category. The points awarded for different education levels are shown below:

Completed EducationPoints Awarded
Master’s degree, or a Ph.D. plus 17 years or more full-time study25
Two or more bachelor level university degrees plus 15 years or more of full-time study22
Three-year diploma, apprenticeship, or trade certificate plus 15 years or more of full-time study22
University bachelor’s degree for a program lasting two years or more plus 14 years or more of full-time study20
Two-year diploma, apprenticeship, or trade certificate plus 14 years or more of full-time study20
University bachelor’s degree for a program lasting one year plus 13 years or more of full-time study

University bachelor’s degree for a program lasting one year plus 13 years or more of full-time study

University bachelor’s degree for a program lasting one year plus 13 years or more of full-time study		15
One-year diploma, apprenticeship, or trade certificate plus 13 years or more of full-time study15
Two-year diploma, apprenticeship, or trade certificate plus 12 years or more of full-time study12
High school5
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Experience” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077209856{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665077289769{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Applicants that have gained relevant experience in the five years preceding the application can receive up to 35 points. The points awarded for different years of experience are summarized below:

Years of Relevant ExperiencePoints Awarded
Two years20
Three25
Four30
Five35
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Age Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077406786{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665077390491{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Indian applicants can be awarded up to 10 points based on their age. These points are summarized below:

AgePoints Awarded
16 or younger0
172
184
196
208
21 to 4910
508
516
524
532
54 or older0
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Language Ability” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077455240{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Indian applicants can receive up to 24 points if they are proficient in English or French. Applicants are awarded points based on their performance in language exams for the following abilities:

Language ProficiencyPoints Awarded in Each Area
SpeakingListeningReadingWriting
High 4444
Moderate 2222
Basic 1111
No proficiency0000
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”5. Adaptability” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077479048{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Indian applicants may be awarded up to 6 points if they meet certain adaptability requirements such as:

Adaptability CategoryPoints Awarded
Common-law partner or spouse with a post-secondary education:

  • One-year diploma, apprenticeship, or trade certificate plus 12 years or more of full-time study: 3 points

  • Two-year diploma, apprenticeship, or trade certificate plus 14 years or more of full-time study: 4 points

  • Master’s degree or Ph.D. plus 17 years or more of full-time study: 5 points
3 to 5
Applicant or applicant’s partner has one year or more of full-time Canadian work experience while on a work permit.5
Applicant or applicant’s partner has finished studying at a full-time program lasting two years or more at a Canadian post-secondary institution. This must be completed above the age of 17 and with a valid study permit. A degree or diploma is not completely necessary to earn these points.5
Applicant or applicant’s partner has relatives residing in Canada. This includes parents, grandparents, children, grandchildren, siblings, aunts or uncles, nieces or nephews.5
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”1″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Criteria to Meet Before Applying for Self-Employed Visa Canada” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077702411{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants must meet three vital criteria before applying for the Self-Employed Persons Program. These are:[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Points Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665077788146{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665077978819{padding-top: 20px !important;}”]This is the first step for Indian applicants who must score a minimum of 35 points out of 100 to be eligible to apply under this program.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Relevant Experience” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665078019960{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665078121390{padding-top: 20px !important;}”]Not all Indian applicants that come from sports or creative fields are eligible to apply under this program. Indian professionals must meet the relevant work experience requirements mentioned above.

They must also demonstrate that they have worked in a professional capacity in these fields. Such applicants may include their portfolios to showcase their work experience and achievements.

This requirement is critical, as Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) would prefer professionals who have worked in these fields at a high level. They should demonstrate through this portfolio that they are among the best in their respective field.

Prospective applicants can reach out to Colossus Migration for assistance with this. Our professionals can assess an applicant’s work experience and optimize their Self-Employed Visa Canada application portfolio.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”4%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”3/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Self-Employed Status and Business Plan” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654519534078{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Indian applicants must be willing and able to become self-employed once they receive permanent resident status in Canada. They must demonstrate their willingness by including a comprehensive business plan with their application.

This business plan must include key details such as:

  • Applicant’s background and work experience
  • Where the applicant plans to settle in Canada
  • How do they intend to establish themselves as self-employed professionals in their field of work and become self-sufficient
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”7320″ animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665078264906{padding-top: 20px !important;}”]A business plan also helps applicants demonstrate that they will contribute to Canada’s economy rather than become dependent on its social system. A great business plan should be able to convince a Canadian visa officer of this easily.

An applicant who cannot sufficiently demonstrate that they will be self-employed will be rejected, even if they meet all the other eligibility criteria. At Colossus Migration, we can help applicants create a robust business plan that meets the required standards.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Application Process: Self-Employed Visa Canada” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665080360397{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665080333942{padding-bottom: 30px !important;}”]Prospective self-employed Indians can apply for the Self-Employed person program using the following steps:[/vc_column_text]

  • Obtain the Application Package
  • Gather Your Documents
  • Pay the Application Fees
  • Submit Your Application
  • Submit Your Biometrics and Photos
  • Receiving a Confirmation of Permanent Residence
[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding_phone=”10%” bottom_padding_phone=”10%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”1″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Obtaining an Application Package” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665079137176{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665079153873{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Indian applicants can obtain an application package for the Self-Employed person program from the Government of Canada website. They will need to complete the application form included and hit the “validate” button once it is complete.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Gathering the Required Documents” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665079170533{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665079186664{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Indian applicants should then gather the documents mentioned in the document checklist included in the application package. This includes:

  • Language exam results
  • Education documents
  • Work experience documents
  • Passports and other travel documents
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Paying the Application Fees” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665079204799{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665079274896{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Applicants will then need to pay application fees. This includes:

  • Processing fees
  • Right of Permanent Residence fees
  • Biometrics fees
  • Other fees for third-parties

All the above fees must be paid online at the Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) website.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Submitting an Application” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665079220125{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665079291652{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]After completing each of the application requirements, applicants submit their applications to the concerned immigration department.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”5. Sending Biometrics and Photos” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665079239737{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665079307215{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Applicants will then be contacted and told to submit their biometrics. This includes items such as fingerprints and photos. Applicants will have 30 days to submit these once they receive the initial request.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”6. Receiving a Confirmation of Permanent Residence” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665079255187{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1665079329075{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]If successful, Indian applicants will receive a Confirmation of Permanent Residence along with an entry visa into Canada.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#fafafa” scene_position=”center” top_padding_phone=”10%” bottom_padding_phone=”10%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”1″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”How COLOSSUS can help you?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1651216426087{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Prospective Indian applicants who wish to apply for Canadian immigration through the Self-Employed Person Program should contact Colossus Migration. Our team of immigration experts, Under the guidance of our CEO & Principal Consultant Keshav Sharma, not only helps the applicants with their immigration process but also guides them with creating an apt portfolio that best represents their work experience and a robust business plan that would convince the visa officer of their settlement plan in Canada.

Please get in touch with Colossus Migration to learn more about our services.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#b00f2e” scene_position=”center” constrain_group_1=”yes” top_padding_tablet=”2%” constrain_group_3=”yes” bottom_padding_tablet=”2%” top_padding_phone=”2%” constrain_group_5=”yes” bottom_padding_phone=”2%” text_color=”light” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” class=”h2this” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”both” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=”tilt_alt”][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” top_margin=”5%” bottom_margin=”5%” left_margin_phone=”3%” right_margin_phone=”3%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” el_class=”testimonial” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Apply for Canada Self-Employed Visa from India

Get Canadian permanent residence as self-employed through Canada’s Self-employed Persons Program.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default”
